page.title: 14THE RWSABC
page.content: THE ROYAL WEST OF SCOTLAND AMATEUR BOAT CLUB HAS ROWING FACILITIES FOR PLEASURE AND COMPETITIVE RACING. IT ALSO HAS SAILING DINGYS AND CANOES. THE RWSABC IS THE ONLY ROWING CLUB IN SCOTLAND WITH THE TITLE 'ROYAL'. THIS WAS BESTOWED ON THE CLUB 100 YEARS AGO BY QUEEN VICTORIA. THE WEST OF SCOTLAND AMATEUR BOAT CLUB,AS IT WAS THEN KNOWN, SUPPLIED A GIG(A LARGE ROWING BOAT) IN ORDER THAT QUEEN VICTORIA COULD BE ROWED ACROSS LOCH MAREE AT HER REQUEST. THIS YEAR THE CLUB CELEBRATES ITS ROYAL CENTENARY. THE CLUB NOW HAS 400 MEMBERS AND HOLD MANY SOCIAL FUNCTIONS AS WELL AS REGATTAS. THE CHAIRMAN OF THE CLUB IS THE VICE-PRESIDENT,THE PRESIDENT IS AN HONORARY TITLE GIVEN TO THE PRESENT SHAW-STEWART,A LOCAL LANDOWNER.
